title: As a support main can we buff Sona
body:
I feel like she is in a bad spot and needs buffs.

She has received nothing but nerfs and hasn't been played in LCS in forever!! Buff her damage so she can actually lane solidly again! She's outclassed by every other support in the game besides like Taric who is getting reworked soon.

Signed,

A support main XD

replies.body: I feel for all the people saying Sona needs some love at the moment, but I have to say I'm not convinced that she just needs more damage. From what I've read  recently, it honestly seems like being the best lane poke support just isn't all that valuable at the moment. I'll admit it could just be that poke _could_ be a powerful lane strategy for her and she doesn't have the numbers to do it reliably, but I feel like giving her something powerful she is best at once the laning phase has ended would do her a ton of good in the long run. I frequently read about how her lane damage just isn't what is used to be, and that she needs it to perform. It could be true that she needs her lane damage to be higher, but her contribution to the game probably shouldn't be downhill from there, unless we try to push a direction akin to "Sona is _the_ lane bully support." I really don't see that being a good solution, though, because many of the concerns about Sona come from high elo players, and game tend to have shorter laning phases the higher elo they are played in.

Maybe you could give your thoughts on this, as I've said it many times as have other people but you haven't responded with your thoughts on our position. Just asked the question on each thread. Her issue isn't her support style. Yes, poke supports aren't as meta because tank supports are in at the moment, but poke supports have been in since Sona's rework, yet Sona has either been oppressive and nerfed hard, or weak in higher level play.

Her issue is everything she does scales off AP. Before she had a utility floor that scaled off teammate purchases and stats, not her own gold. This created a floor that allowed her to vary her build based on what she needed in that specific instance. She could build aura items with some mitigation and act as a flag bearer almost, pushing her team on with useful easy to tune auras or build AP and be a burst mage with utility effects in her downtime. In the early game she would have to bounce auras slower, and manage her stances, and in frantic fights, she could cycle her auras, giving her teamates the full benefit of them all, while managing her power chord and getting the appropriate effect. 

Currently she has to build AP, everything scales off of it. She has no utility floor, and her abilities are all balanced on the fact that she must build AP, because when they weren't, she could build pure AP and get massive damage and utility at the same time. There is no differentiation between her mage spell damage playstyle and her utility support playstyle as they both need the same stats, so building for one builds for both.

It's not a balanceable situation, so what you end up with is a champion that is easy to play because of the PBAoE auto targeting effects, that dramatically falls off based on opponent awareness of her abilities, and allies willingness or ability to stay close. 

When the enemy is aware of what Sona can do, Sona can't do anything, because her ratio's and bases were nerfed so they wouldn't be a problem with her new scaling identity. Issue is she's not strong enough without those items to face her opponent without them. When she get's them she isn't even a "Hyper-support" as her ratios and effects were made to scale appropriately with items rather than strongly to compensate for her weak early game.

What Sona used to be, for me at least, was the ultimate buff support. And a surprisingly deep one that had a ton of little things you would pick up on as you got better. She had poke, but she brought more buffs to the team than any other support. I was able to work on proper positioning in teamfights, managing ability chains and decision making to decide which power chord I would want to use rather than just spamming QWEAAQWEAAQWEAA and wondering why my powerchord wasn't doing as much damage as I thought it should. 

Not unrelated, but undirected, if (nontargeted) you don't understand why Sona's powerchord wouldn't do a lot of damage in the described situation you're one of the players that thought she was just a depthless champion that took no thought.

Current Sona's AoE's are 350 range IIRC, Soraka's W was 450 range and it was buffed as it was realized that her trying to get that close to the frontline to buff an ally wasn't a reasonable expectation. Additionally there is less ability management incentive to the new effects as the effects are so short lived. Because the new effects are one off consumable, or short duration, you don't incentivize intelligent usage, instead simply try to get the most effect on your team as possible as there is no penalty to not doing so.

This really is a situation where previous healthy gameplay that was enjoyed by many players, even if it isn't the type of mechanic that Riot likes, should transcend intention. This is a rework that should be reverted. It really feels like healthy gameplay was made unbalanceable, unique gameplay was lost, and a playstyle that was enjoyed by many was deleted because the rework crew didn't like it and got a chance to do so.

> Currently she has to build AP, everything scales off of it. She has no utility floor, and her abilities are all balanced on the fact that she must build AP, because when they weren't, she could build pure AP and get massive damage and utility at the same time. There is no differentiation between her mage spell damage playstyle and her utility support playstyle as they both need the same stats, so building for one builds for both.

Yeah, this is something I've read quite a few times now as well, about her baseline effectiveness being too low before items. There may be something to that, as this could be a pretty limiting disadvantage relative to other supports, especially when behind.

Yeah, I'll agree to that. Her Q is her only real good ability before she buys AP, and even then it drops off like a rock after laning phase unless she gets a lich bane (which she shouldn't be encouraged to do; why is a support's best item a selfish damage item?) Her W has terrible heal-to-mana ratio, possibly the worst in the game, and her E is barely a spell, I only use it early game for power chord (either to slow or just to get to a Q quicker).

>her E is barely a spell

I'd just like to point out that the most sucsesful Sona skill ranking completely ignores E until level 8. That should tell you there's something wrong with the spell.

http://champion.gg/champion/Sona

Edit: It's also probably a problem that coin builds are stronger than spellthief's builds, but that's more a problem with the item than Sona.

while e does little early on in lane(which is why you ignore it till lvl 8), it is really powerfull later in the game, a huge Low cd AoE speed-buff is really a huge deal.
Which is one of the major Sona Problems, so much of her power is in that skill later on, and ~90% of the players don't notice/understand it and thus can't apreacheate what she brings for the team. IUt's probably the biggest case off invisible power in the game(maybe ayfter Jannas passive)

thats overall a bit off a problem ever since the utillity-ratios were introduced for most supports. They no longer have much choice between ap for damage/shields/heals or utillity items for utillity, but they either get ap to get all of it, or utillity items to just get utillity with no damage/shields.

Lulu also feels a bit lackluster on the baseline(especially W on allies, but also her shield), but scales great with Ap, so she gets played in sololanes.
Sona scales even harder with AP, but does not have the tools to really succed in a sololane(no waveclear, little defensive tools)
Nami is in a bit better spot, but also somewhat ap dependend, her E ans W feel **slightly **lackluster compared to the manacosts without AP, so does her passive(which gets buffed on PBE)

The only exeption is Janna, as she is broken by design, sh's just way to powerfull in doing her job, while also beeing quite solid in other tasks...
She's the hardest hardcounter ever to be seen, defying any dive-comp, makeing all atemps to get into her team void...
There is a good reason for why she has the highest winrate in soloQ while beeing a powerfull pick in professional play.

Utillity ratios are also not balanceable around low ap builts. Either the ratios are so low that the effect off 100-200 ap is hardly noticeable, or the ratios are high and sololane-high ap builts escalate quickly(pre nerf lulu), or ratios are high and base are low, so you feel like you need a ~200 ap threshold just to offset the poor base...
I think Utillity ratios are a nice tool to creat utillity focused sololaners(a great nich mostly covered by lulu atm), but they don't work on supports.

Zekes kinda goes into that direction, which is why you see it on top/mid/jungle but not support in proplay, as the 20% ap does little if you rarly hit more than 100ap, but on a midlaner it easily compensates for the else meager stats of the item(in terms of slot-efficiency, not cost-efficiency), so it's a cost-efficient utillity tem that scales into lategame on midlaners...while beeing more a luxority item with meager scaleing on supports.

in design, sona performs more like a carry ever since the rework. all of her spells benefit her more than they do anyone else. this low baseline is ONE of the reasons for it. 

her W also has the added problem of costing too much to attempt to use it in a way that benefits the adc. if you use it and nobody is damaged while the shield is up, casting the spell has a negative value, the heal just isnt good enough to spend that much mana on. every-time you cast W and nobody is damaged you think "wow, i just wasted mana... that could have been more q harass" this causes you to make decisions to use it based on when you know that YOU will be taking damage, as its hard to know for sure how anyone else will respond to any given situation.

her E is GREAT for sona. she can use it to dodge skills and re-position in fights fairly easily. its base value is fine, FOR HER. when it comes to benefiting an ally... it just doesn't.  sure, it provides a short burst of speed, which in theory could do the same for your adc as it does for you... but the shortened duration for your ally makes it so that they often cant take advantage of it properly. 

considering her Q is her best basic ability, you have a damage based champ with great kiting potential who trades well with w activated. sounds like a carry, doesnt it?

This thread is mostly troll from what I've seen. 

Imo Sona does not need more damage, even if it's gotten nerfed over time and a buff would help her. 

Like you said, she needs something that keeps her relevant once laning phase has ended. I think that's one of the main reason why Sona's build has shifted from Aura/Support items and gone full on glass cannon/high ap.

I don't main {{champion:37}} but unless that {{champion:412}} or {{champion:89}} has their engage on cooldown and consistently lands it her Q damage is actually ludicrous. I actually had a game recently where my ADC was {{champion:21}} only using Double-up, I just kept moving close to Ezreal/Leona, hitting Q, autoing whoever was in range once, and backing off. _Everyone else lost their lane_ (though to be fair the Jungle Lee came bot once, failed, and subsequently never tried ganking us again) meanwhile Ezreal and Leona were useless because they got poked out so hard.

She doesn't need more damage in my opinion, her Aria of Perseverance and Song of Celerity (especially Song of Celerity, which is worthless unless all 5 are present) need to be buffed. _Also maybe a little more survivability wouldn't kill her but I'll leave that one to the Balance Team to decide._

to be honest what i really think Sona (and mage supports in general) need is just better itemization since they need some degree of AP to do well and most AP items that are for supports quite frankly i would never pick due to how bad they are. 

{{item:3092}} is THE AP support item... at least it would be but the stats it gives leaves a lot to be desired and the slow while powerful isn't enough to hold the item in a good way. All other GP items get solid stats and reliable actives while the passive gets better or are easier to use. Almost no one upgrades {{item:3303}} into {{item:3092}} and just rather swap it or leave it there until they need the slot for something else.

{{item:3504}} this item has a lot of potential but once again, the AP it gives is too small and the passive, at least in my opinion, is lackluster. The passive either needs to be better or give slightly more AP or something but as of right now the item is too niche and not very useful even when the niche scenario is available.

{{item:3050}} this on the other hand is a great item for supports (although ironically it's easier seen in solo laners than supports) since it gives decent stats all around and the active feels rewarding to use.

Support itemization is the main thing that is holding mage supports from being that useful the later the game goes since if they want to reach decent amounts of AP they either need to invest in lackluster items or go into the expensive items from solo laners which by the time they do manage to get them it could be too late.

If your going to give her something later on in the game. I'd recommend looking at her auras. Later in the game, She should be good at manipulating the battle field by tagging her allies. And she should feel good doing so.

As for her laning phase. I'd argue say she needs her MS nerf reverted. Mostly in the sense that she basically has less ability to dodge skillshots and other enemy engage tools. Sona is squishy and will give if caught, but that happens too often, and she has no reliable way to try and evade. 

But as for why poke supports arn't viable at the moment, I feel like that's a problem that could be fixed with the frost queen's line. It feels next to useless to actually upgrade, and it doesn't help poke supports do that much additional damage.

Sona definitely needs some help after the lane phase. She just has a lot of scaling issues. 

Her damage scaling is actually quite low for a champ who relies so much on damage, I can understand lower scaling because of her heal but I think atm it might be just a little bit too low especially since she can't really afford AP.

She also has to basically function with 3 spells + her passive. Her E barely does anything. It's kind of like having a Janna passive that costs mana, has a 12 second CD and requires your ally to be within every single AOE ever's range from you.

There's also a few issues with her lane. At the moment it's kind of a necessity for supports to have some form of immobilising CC on a basic ability. The top 6 support picks in the LCK this split (by P/B) for example were {{champion:12}} , {{champion:412}} , {{champion:40}} , {{champion:111}} , {{champion:201}} and {{champion:1}} . You just can't get away with running a support who can't lock down someone in the lane phase in high level play.

Meanwhile Annie gets ALL her damage from a longer range than 550, packed with a free stun that allows her to combo more spells that, once again, all come in at a higher range. To boot, the stun lasts long enough to combo each spell in and she can use the stun on things that aren't her ult. TO BOOT, one of these spells is a point-n-click.

Meanwhile Janna's shield can eat up Sona's Q for free regardless of timing. Power Chord on? Yay, you did like 20 damage...*maybe*. Also higher range than 550 on ALL her spells. Even Zephyr.

Meanwhile Nami can easily out-trade you no matter what you do because her damage heals her back while it hits you for about the damage your Q does to her...at a longer range. All of Nami's spells have a longer range than 550.

Blitz's pull? More than 550. Morg's Q? More than 550. Nautilus? More. Leona's damn pull? MORE THAN 550...and she's fking throwing her own sword and JUMPING BACK TO IT. Why does Sona have to be burdened with being in immediate deletion range as a squishy support when even the tanky ass dudes, let alone other squishy supports, get to be half the map away from her and still get all their benefits? She can't even say "I'm squishy, so I'll stay away from the enemy and use my moves and positioning to my advantage". Instead she says "I'm REALLY hoping no one straight up deletes me from the servers while I'm forced to stay one dash's distance from all these assassins and adcs". It takes a bit to put into perspective because of how relatively simple Sona feels to play, but she's fking GIMPED. She needs buffs more than Nami ever did. Like, my goodness. No hard cc outside of ult, an apparently useless movement speed buff, insanely low natural movement speed, no real peel save for her ult, a gimped heal/shield gimmick that forces her to use the thing as a crappy shield instead of a heal because half the heal's value is now a short, crappy shield, and a damage spell that doesn't do full damage unless you're literally in an adc's trading range...while being squishier than adcs are. How is she in a fine spot? How is this aa gimmick fair with an auto range of 550?

id like to jump in here. my suggestion is revert the aura of perseverance nerf (w for you who don't know sona's tunes). awhile back they reduced its missing hp ratio and i think it would be good to give it back because at the moment, it feels super underwhelming to max w in lane because 1, it drains your mana like a sink. 2, the heal itself is underwhelming unless your partner is less than half hp. also having the movement speed back would be great as well. and maybe revisit her song of celerity and maybe give a flat movespeed bonus instead of percent? because percent is really low unless you have upgraded boots already.

Sona needs impactful utility outside of her ultimate in order to compete with other supports. Her heal/shield and movement speed boost are too weak to compensate for her average damage. You want a lane bully support? Play Annie, she can almost full combo adcs, on top of having an accessible, reliable instant cast AOE stun. Want sustain? Janna, Soraka, Lulu, and Nami are infinitely superior in their ability to shield and protect their ADCs. Want to play poke? Play Vel'koz. Sona is in no way exceptional at any of these things on the same caliber as any of those supports, and that's sad.
Buff her damage... that's the one thing she doesn't need buffed.

Let's compare it to Taric then.  both champions have a heal that does them and 1 ally.  However Taric's heal does it for twice the amount.  Once you hit the late game Taric also has his passive to allow for ability spamming if he so desires.  Sona's shield might come into play if it didn't fall off so fast.  As both a bonus and an issue Sona can not choose who she heals, bonus is it will always attempt to heal the ally with the lowest health, downside if they are going to die anyway i might prefer to heal a different champion who isn't 2 seconds away from death regardless.

Let's also point out that her utility floor is a deep dark dungeon.  The base numbers are fairly low, and she has a 20% AP ratio on her heal.  This means that even if you build a very AP heavy "support" build, let's say 400 AP you are still only healing for a bonus 80 health per cast.

I personally would rather have a different ability for her E then the movement speed buff.  Even with max CDR you can only cast it once per 7.2 seconds and it only works for 1.5 seconds on your allies.  Even in long chases where it's most useful you end up having to pop it something like 3-5 times before the speed bonus adds up enough to have a real effect.  So you are using 195-325 mana over the course of 30-40 seconds to MAYBE catch or escape an enemy.
